forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy. Low around 51, with temperatures rising to around 53 overnight. Southeast wind around 10 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely before 4pm. Cloudy. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. South wind 7 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 30 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The first light of Saturday in Downtown San Francisco greets the day with a muted palette, cloaking the skyline in a thick embrace of gray. The air is draped with the promise of rain, and the low hum of the wind carries a soft urgency, hinting at the changing weather. As the hour draws nearer to dawn, temperatures hover around a cool 51 degrees, with nippy gusts stirring from the southeast, giving a slight chill as they dance through the city’s narrow streets and across the sprawl of rooftops.

Throughout the day, clouds will loom heavily, and sporadic rain is likely to weave through the afternoon, casting a damp yet adventurous spirit over the city. With highs reaching just below 60, the slight drop in temperature will offer a gentle reprieve, urging coats and layered garments back into service. While the vibrant energy of city life flows along the streets, it’s an ideal time for a quiet stroll through the shops of the Ferry Building, where the aroma of freshly brewed coffee mingles with the scent of baked goods, or perhaps a visit to one of the many cozy cafés lining the Mission. With the chance of rain lingering and the sky adorned with a blanket of cloud, this is a day to embrace comfort, sip warm drinks, and find solace in the gentle rhythm of the city as it adjusts to the soft percussion of raindrops on pavement.
